LanguageData.VV_Letter_ViviEggHatched: A new Vivi has hatched from an egg laid by {PARENT_labelShort}. Vivi grow and learn faster than typical humans but have shorter lifespans. They also inherit random genetic modifiers at birth, including those from their mother. \nIf Vivi consume enough royal jelly during their growth stage, they develop into royal vivi, who live longer and can lay eggs. royal vivi have higher mental sensitivity and social skills but significantly lower work abilities and slower movement.

LanguageData.VV_Letter_RoyalViviGrown: {PAWN_labelShort} has consumed enough royal jelly to grow into a royal vivi.
LanguageData.VV_Letter_IncidentHornetSwarmArrived: A frenzied swarm of titanic hornets has appeared. They will roam around and attack any life forms they encounter. Titanic hornets are very fast and durable, difficult to take down with conventional weapons, but vulnerable to fire and poison. \nThey cannot pass through doors, so hiding behind walls is safe. They will indiscriminately hunt the nearest targets, so it is advisable to hide if you lack adequate defenses. The swarm will hunt everything moving in the area and will leave on its own after a few days.
LanguageData.VV_Letter_Linkeverflower: {PAWN_labelShort} has formed an attunement link with an everflower. While an attuned royal vivi stays in an area containing environment mana, a small amount is absorbed, slowly strengthening the link; as it grows stronger, the vivi gradually gains the ability to wield the everflowers mana. \nAttuned royal vivi takes reduced incoming damage from all sources, but any damage that would hit the everflower is instead redirected to the linked vivi. The link endures until either partner dies; however, if they become very far apart or the vivi is blocked, the bond weakens and its effects—and related abilities—are suspended. \nIf the everflower is destroyed, the vivi's attunement link is weakened but not lost, allowing the vivi to attune to a new everflower and continue the bond.
